text: <@U060JS28BNJ> we have a ticket open for this but I just wanted to re-iterate. We keep seeing this problem when trying to create workflows. Once we create enough in a portal this appears.

`HTTP_429 Internal rate limit error: com.HubSpot.apicaller.exceptions.ApiFailure: Api[name=automation-platform-client, httpMethod=POST, subPath=/v1/hybrid/create-internal, correlationId=ed63e9ab-37df-4583-9f2e-4ad2eac50976] Failed to process your request. Error code was '429'. Error message was: {"status":"error","message":"{\"status\":\"error\",\"message\":\"Too many requests list:create portalId: 46262705 userId: 6713053 [Limit 4000, expires in 108473251ms, usage 4000]\",\"correlationId\":\"ed63e9ab-37df-4583-9f2e-4ad2eac50976\"}","correlationId":"ed63e9ab-37df-4583-9f2e-4ad2eac50976"}`
We are not creating 4000 lists before this. So its very perplexing and it prevents us from creating any workflows.
For 24 hours which is quite disriptive
Hi Minsu. I will try to recreate these requests and let you know if they succeed
Hello, getting a 500 internal server error response when attempting to GET a single workflow :thread:

`GET` request to this URL:
<https://api.hubapi.com/automation/v4/flows/7144643>

Returns:
```{
    "status": "error",
    "message": "internal error",
    "correlationId": "2f1544d8-90e2-464b-8791-8159bfb5873e"
}```
7144643 is returned from:
<https://api.hubapi.com/automation/v4/flows>
Hi Kyle, there's a bug when fetching that specific workflow - we will try to merge a fix asap!
Thanks, weâ€™ll look into this as part of the ticket. cc: <@U07CC054V7S>
Hi Kyle, thanks for reaching out!
yeah this one is really important because we cant update existing workflows, if we have to re-run our migration we end up making duplicates.

Looks like the error message is not entirely accurate and the Hub you are trying to access needs to be upgraded. You can view the upgrade options  mentioned in the <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/workflows/create-workflows|create workflows> documentation.
Thank you Bill. Can the error message be updated to reflect that?
Yes, I will certainly look into that!
